website_summaries.verdict: A powerful 6-ton log splitter with a performance that is comparable to higher price machines.
pros: Southland's electric log splitter is capable of splitting 20.5-inch logs that are up to 10 inches in diameter every 18 seconds
The large, 7-inch wheels and soft-grip handles facilitate transportation
This unit can be stored vertically if space is a concern
cons: You must check the log splitter when it arrives to be certain that no hydraulic fluid was lost during transit

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product, wish I would have gone larger.
customer_reviews.text: This wood splitter is easy to use and works great, the only problem is that I wish I would have gone with a more powerful model. To clarify, it works great for smaller pieces, 10" to 14" round or so. The issue then becomes when I do cut down a larger tree. I recently learned this splitter's limits and have about three trees worth of wood it can't handle. Don't get me wrong, if your working with smaller sizes this splitter will handle it well. But 25-30 inch around pieces are just too much for this little guy!
customer_reviews.author: David D.

customer_reviews.title: A great buy for anyone looking for a splitter!
customer_reviews.text: So thankful we bought this. We are the people who scout out wood and friends having trees cut down. We had about three trees worth waiting to be chopped and dealt with. This made a huge pile of work that would have been days off chopping and splitting with a wedge in to a few hours of work. The only limit was on dealing with the length of wood. It only adjusts smaller not longer. So we had to chainsaw some stuff, but it worked like a champ. It pushed through some wood that we had struggled with before. Very easy to operate and comes with very little assembly (basically just putting wheels on).
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: This thing is well made and has all the power ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is well made and has all the power that I need. No more gas engine to deal with and all that it requires. Just plug it in and it splits anything that I have asked it to.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.

customer_reviews.title: it is awesome.  put down the splitting mall.
customer_reviews.text: I am retired, disabled, and heat with wood. This is a life saver. Getting in wood has never been easier. I was surprised how easily it splits logs. Thanks southland.
customer_reviews.author: joyce marshall

customer_reviews.title: 1 cord so far, good to go
customer_reviews.text: Arrived boxed well, easy to use out of the box. I like the "short stop" feature unique to this machine. A quick stop at hardware store got me a connector and #8 6" extender for the activation lever allowing for 1 hand operation. I need one hand to hold some wood in place. This splitter comes with slightly wider wheels than others. Wider wheels would be Very attractive. Splitter is working well, no issues in function. I painted bright yellow on the oil release screw so that I don't forget to release or close it during operations. I like it. Went through a cord of maple easily.
customer_reviews.author: W. B.

customer_reviews.title: Worked for my wood stash
customer_reviews.text: Gave it a workout yesterday, seemed to bog with hickory wood (max length 12" x 9" diameter). Then just did smaller segments off side to eventually split. Occasionally needed to rotate/flip wood piece. Did not use on pieces larger than 18", straining noise on ram retraction - checked hydraulic fluid before use and filled, opened vent; hope all is OK. Unsure what hydraulic oil, picked up some based on review, manual NO help for specifications - only company brand names. Used Home Depot’s Power Care AW32 hydraulic oil. Hope it last more than one season. Very portable and like that it's electric.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Gipson

customer_reviews.title: Broke the second day
customer_reviews.text: I used this twice for no more than twenty pieces of wood. My wood is already split i bought this to split it even smaller for my small wood stove.. One if the arms bent on the second day. There were no stuck pieces or knots. The frame is just not strong enough to handle the force the ram can produce. Sent it back and bought a stronger machine3
customer_reviews.author: Philiprm

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy electric splitter for occasional use
customer_reviews.text: I needed a wood splitter to deal with the occasional tree on our property taken down by a wind storm, etc.--something in the middle range between a splitting maul or manual hydraulic splitter and a robust gasoline-powered unit. This solid little Southland 6hp electric unit fits the bill, easily splitting 10" diameter chunks of hardwood/softwood (green or dry) up to 20" in length (but easily adjusted for ~16" lengths). It's not really an all-day production tool, but for a couple hours or an afternoon it sure beats a splitting maul! It's compact size makes it easy to store, but also makes it a bit tippy--make sure to set it up on flat, level ground for maximum stability.
customer_reviews.author: Clutch Cargo

customer_reviews.title: A great splitter for the price
customer_reviews.text: I must say I am very impressed with the splitter performance. I already own a 35 ton gas splitter. I split and sell about 15 cords of wood per year. This electric splitter helps split the larger pieces into kindling for starters for my wood stove. It also helps me split wood into smaller pieces for selling to people who want the occasional fire for the fireplace. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Art Busch

customer_reviews.title: I would definitely recommend. Nice job to the company and engineering
customer_reviews.text: I used a gas splitter in the past. This unit works with the same speed and power without the gas, oil or weight. I’m very impressed. I would definitely recommend. Nice job to the company and engineering. Only thing I don’t like is it takes two hands to run. I’m sure it’s for safety. I’ll have to see it I can bypass the safety switch. I’d still give it a 100 o/o
customer_reviews.author: Steve b.

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have big expectations for this splitter but it really surprised me. Used it throughout the winter to split a lot of hardwood such as oak and madrone. It was able to cut 99% of whatever I'd throw at it, I think I've only had a handful of pieces if that I wasn't able to split, but those pieces were so dense not even my splitting maul would cut it, ended up having to use a chainsaw for those pieces.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this log splitter for my husband for his birthday and when he opened the package he was so excited he went outside and used it immediately. He says it is the best gift he has ever received! Splits logs easily and quickly for our fireplace and the outside fire ring. He has had it about one year, uses it extensively and it has never let him down.
customer_reviews.author: H. White

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse!
customer_reviews.text: Product is heavy duty and easy to use. It does take 2 ppl to operate. Need 1 person to handle controls and one person to hold wood from shooting out, but not always. I have had several time that I tried operating alone and the wood im spliting shoots out with force in any given direction. Split a bunch of wood with no issues so far and usually you dont have to go threw the whole piece. After a few inches it splits nice. I would recommend this to anyone. Only thing is I would like it taller, but im using a table so no big deal just preference
customer_reviews.author: actually right

customer_reviews.title: Not made to split knarly hard woods
customer_reviews.text: This item is easy to use and move around. I split pine with it and had no problems but when I put in a gum tree piece that was only 5" in diameter and 12 " long I had to use a piece of wood behind it to make it split. I can't imagine this splitter splitting any hard wood like Elm, Oak or apple wood very good, but that statement is un tried so don't really know. Also make sure your pieces of wood are cut straight or the Ram head slides a little and doesn't split it evenly. over all it is a good splitter for light duty and soft wood.
customer_reviews.author: G Mclean

customer_reviews.title: Performs Beyond Expectations!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding log splitter. Wish I had purchased one years ago, would have saved my back and avoided many a sore night. Very easy to use. Very well built, heavy duty, and handles more than the 20" diameter logs recommended (but not too much bigger). Surprisingly powerful. Very happy with this log splitter. It's about 110 pounds so one may need some help lifting. However, it is easily transportable as one can roll it like a dolly.
customer_reviews.author: J Zulu

customer_reviews.title: It’s a POS
customer_reviews.text: Bottom line: does not deliver 6 tons of pressure. Doesn’t matter how maneuverable or easy to use, this POS log splitter WILL NOT get the job done. I thought the oak I was splitting might still be a little green so I dried it for another 6 months in dry heat. Pulled the splitter back out and no difference. Borrowed a friend’s 5-ton electric splitter and it cut through like a dried twig. I had bought two of these and sent one to a friend...same conclusion. This will not split a 12” long 7” diameter piece of wood. Can’t even chip away at it. A worthless machine in my shed...like I really have room for that!
customer_reviews.author: Tim Glines

customer_reviews.title: Awesome splitter for your money
customer_reviews.text: Compact and works great !! I cut up and split an entire 60 foot maple tree this past week. This splitter worked awesome, it easily handled wood up to 14 inches in diameter that I had cut into 20” sections. I had some oak from another tree, and it was much harder than the maple. This splitter didn’t like the oak much over 12” in diameter because of the hardness. But for the money, this little unit is great ! It’s very quiet too.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Love

customer_reviews.title: Functionally great, needs a larger manual and some elevation
customer_reviews.text: The manual is a problem. It's not that the manual is bad, it's just way too small and difficult to read. It feels like they couldn't afford larger paper and ended up saving a few pennies. Other than that, it does a good job. It's pretty easy to use - although we found it much easier to use once we had it elevated. It's much too low as it comes and isn't kind to your back when using it for more than a few minutes. I'd have given it five stars is the manual had been better and it had some kind of a base elevating it to a more comfortable height - functionally it's very good.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great value!!!
customer_reviews.text: Impressed. For the price, I didn't expect a lot. I was pleasantly surprised. Split a 14" x 20" log without straining . It easily split logs that my axe just bounced off of. Downfall is you have to push a button and hold a lever at the same time. It struggles with really large knots. On the plus side, it's quiet, quick, and no carbon monoxide. Use it anywhere there's an outlet. I'd recommend this to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Russell L Norton Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Little machine, HUGE RESULTS.
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS LITTLE GUY. This splitter is a beast for it's small form factor. Came out of the box ready to use and literally used it for a week straight without any issues. If it will fit in the splitter, most cases it will split the log and I have put huge trunks in it. It's electric and just works great. I HIGHLY recommend this unit for the price. One thing you may want to buy with it is some additional hydrollic fluid as some people have wrote theirs were low when the recieved it. Don't think about it, buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine
customer_reviews.text: This splitter is perfect for home use. I split wood easily to fit into the little 18" firebox on my woodstove. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because they don't offer a stand (a must for safety so user isn't leaning over it when wood launches unexpectedly), and the stroke limiter set screw isn't strong enough to actually stay set. Otherwise a wonderful little gadget.
customer_reviews.author: Happy1

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and store
customer_reviews.text: This easy to use 6 ton splitter is very handy to keep inside my building and roll out when I need to split cook wood. Small footprint storage and quick to plug in and start splitting. Splits my 18" to 20" long Red Oak and Pecan easily. I place this unit on a 30" high table for convenience of use. I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: dolitle

customer_reviews.title: Saved my back
customer_reviews.text: I should have gotten one of these years ago. No more slinging the axe or sledge hammer and wedge. I split a winter's worth of wood with this unit and it performed just as expected. As long as you keep the unit level and the log sizes with-in the manufacture's requirements, you'll have no issues. Wear your safety glasses!! Great little unit that has saved my back!
customer_reviews.author: Poncho

customer_reviews.title: Buy this splitter!!!
customer_reviews.text: I split a face cord with the splitter and it did awesome. Only getting four stars because the leg for the wheel was bent; did not hinder performance. I have a 7 & 9 year old that ran the machine perfectly. When they got tired I could run the machine with one hand. I am interested, and will keep you posted, on how it runs in the summer. The “2 hand” operation seems more dangerous. With kids yes, buy alone I had logs jumping at me; would have been fine if I had a free hand to support the split. Overall, I would buy this splitter again and recommend it to my friends!
customer_reviews.author: Bubbams

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: What’s there not to love about this little wonder. It arrives very well packaged to protect it in shipping. Attaching the wheels takes about 1 minute and then you’re off to the log splitting races! I’m not doing any marathon splitting sessions. Just a few cut up trunks for our fire pit burn. Everything worked as advertised!
customer_reviews.author: JDG

customer_reviews.title: A handy small splitter for wood stoves
customer_reviews.text: A decent splitter for small easy to split logs at a good price. I have been using it for a month in my cellar. I also have a 40 year old full size gasoline splitter for large logs. The instructions are useless because of poor quality photos. I still cannot find the hydraulic fluid fill hole. The ram could go a bit further, the ram adjustment pull back is easy to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph D.

customer_reviews.title: Best little splitter ever!!
customer_reviews.text: oh boy do i love this splitter... i'm in my 70's and the days of swinging an ax to split wood are over ... easy set up ... and i put some of the toughest logs through this thing ... slightly over-sized live oak ...60 lbs a cubic foot ... and not well dried out ... had to cut back into 12" sections as it was still green ...other full size logs properly dried split easily ...love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: PADDLETENNIS STEVE

customer_reviews.title: Excellent electric log splitter!
customer_reviews.text: When I received it, I immediately tested it with a few logs. First was about 8 inches diameter, no problem, split with no effort. Then I set a 15 inch oak log on, and it walked right through it although I had to rotate the log a couple times to finish splitting into several pieces, it performed perfectly! Highly reccomend!
customer_reviews.author: Papagrizz

customer_reviews.title: Very good item
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product. It may have a little trouble with logs over ten inches, but well worth the money. Has a good safety feature that requires one hand pushing the power button and one actuating the hydraulic valve. I like it. Also very heavy duty. I shopped around and looked at several splitters before purchasing. Very satisfied. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tools ease my life

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product at the end of November,2019. I to take it in for repair on the ram, it would not retract. Called Southland for help, no help. advised take it to service center. service center had to ask me how to operate it. Needless to say not working to good. Wast of money, Buy a good brand name at your local store.
customer_reviews.author: John Wood

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and sturdy too!
customer_reviews.text: My teenage boys put it together and cut many pieces of wood that were too large for my wood burning stove. No problems at all. If my two 16 year olds can do it, anyone can. The boys actually wanted to use it. They kept switching off who had to find the wood from the wood pile and who got to use the machine. It is a little heavy, but even this 50 year old mother of four can roll it on its wheels from our front porch through the dirt and into the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa G

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews, but I received this yesterday and have been very impressed. The only assembly was the wheels which took 30 seconds. Quickly read through the bold print in the manual and started splitting. Has no problem with wet wood. Been splitting about 12" diameter logs like butter. Just happens to be the biggest logs I have right now. The stopper for setting the ram for shorter logs is as easy as it gets. My only gripe is you need to hold a button with one hand and press down the lever with the other. No doubt for safety, but I'd prefer just 1 lever to push.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little splitter!
customer_reviews.text: I had seen mixed reviews of this product, but I’ve found it to be a very good product. Powerful, maneuverable and a good buy for the money. Be sure to tip it up on end before checking level of hydraulic fluid or it will begin to leak out. If that advice was in manual I failed to see it.
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this product a couple months ago for our kids that live in the mountain home, they use a lot of wood for heat. They have reported they just love it. Easy to store and setup yet strong enough to do the job, and quick. Great investment so far.
customer_reviews.author: Lit'lBro

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical about purchasing an electric splitter. I must say that I am very impressed with this model! Very easy to use and powerful enough to split anything I've put to it. Solid construction, easy to move. I set mine up on a raised platform to elevate it to a more comfortable working position, truck tailgate is a little too high. I also use a foot long piece of 1" pvc as a handle extension for the ram lever, makes it easier. Just my thing I came up with. I have to say for the money this splitter is well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Keely

customer_reviews.title: It works even better than I expected!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Use it to split logs already dried out. Has split everything I put in. Adjusting for the log size is wonderful. I have split some 10 & 12 inch logs, but most are smaller. Works great fo kindling. I use a seat to sit down and don't have to bend over. ❤️
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: This Southland splitter is great
customer_reviews.text: Got this splitter today and split a few logs just to give it a run. This thing is a beast. Now if your used to your gas ones then no its not for you. This thing handled my biggest log like a pro. It barely made the clearance and this thing was 18" around split it like butter.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph H.

customer_reviews.title: Good splitter but...
customer_reviews.text: The splitter works well but is very low and requires constant bending. The start button is already sticking after a month and the unit arrived low on hydraulic oil.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Splits any log I have used.
customer_reviews.text: I like the way it splits logs and keeps on working. I have two gripes. 1. The return of the rammer after splitting is slower than I expected. 2. The lever at the rear of the splitter is to close to the top guide, this takes seconds to find the lever and sometimes I hit my fingers on the guide. Other than those two gripes, I like the way it handles. I would recommend this log splitter to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond E. Blunden

customer_reviews.title: Rugged and capable
customer_reviews.text: I have no regrets purchasing this log splitter. It performed well for my needs. However, the controls are poorly designed, requiring both hands to operate, placing me in a very bent-over position. There is a simple, relatively inexpensive modification I made by connecting a foot pedal switch (from Harbor Freight) and extending the hydraulic lever using a piece of threaded rod and a coupler from Lowes which I bent and slid a piece of pipe insulation over and attached the original yellow plastic knob that was on the unit to the end of the extension rod.
customer_reviews.author: jrpics82

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use instruction booklet needs larger clearer illustration of operation The dip stick would be better with a hex nut rather than an Allen wrench top It works very well for the size
customer_reviews.author: David Durant

customer_reviews.title: Want to love it, but stopped working.
customer_reviews.text: Want to love this machine. We get precut firewood delivered but it usually comes too wide for our needs. We have about a cord of oversized dried pine and want to break it down to more manageable sizes. The unit arrived and we put it to use. After about a 1/2 a cord the unit got stuck and now won’t move either direction. Checked the tramission fluid, air release, etc. it gets power and the motor runs, just the hydraulic ram wont move. Buyer beware on this.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R Breier

customer_reviews.title: Check your hydraulic fluid.
customer_reviews.text: Needed fluid right out of the box. topped it off and started splitting. This machine had no trouble with the "wet" wood I tried it out on. I'll try and remember to update when I split some more. So far, I've got a great tool on my hands.
customer_reviews.author: Owen Baker

customer_reviews.title: Great tool but could have been better
customer_reviews.text: if only there were two modes with a different gear ratio that would allow having a slower but more powerful (double the time for 50% increase in pressure power 7.5 ton vs 5 ton) stroke this would be a perfect wood splitter to able to handle initial split of a log and then go back to fast mode to next splittings
customer_reviews.author: N. Kadosh

customer_reviews.title: Light on splitting power.
customer_reviews.text: Southerland has still not sent replacement parts that were missing from original box so can't install weels.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good little splitter
customer_reviews.text: My last electric splitter lasted ten years. This splitter is slightly more powerful but works the same. Good little splitter for small and softwood rounds. May not handle hardwood.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah K. Coddington

customer_reviews.title: Has worked great so far.
customer_reviews.text: I'm an old guy and used to like splitting all my firewood by hand, but the old shoulders just don't like swinging that maul for much over an hour. This thing was almost fun! Place the round, and pop! Most of my wood is well seasoned pine, and not real big, but it handled everything well. If there is a twist, the round will "walk" up the wedge a bit, but re-position and no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Don H.

customer_reviews.title: love this splitter
customer_reviews.text: we live in the woods and have an abundance of trees to cut down for our wood burning stove...and this has enabled us to do it at our leisure instead of renting a splitter.....would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: BRENDA JACKSON

customer_reviews.title: Never had one before
customer_reviews.text: This is my first log splitter wasn't sure on an electric splitter but so far I split about a cord of cooking wood (12" long) and has held up so far.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis M.

customer_reviews.title: Value for money
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. Just stay within the working range recommended 10" diameter 15" length wood. Just cut 1/2 cord green pecan and oak.
customer_reviews.author: Blondie Pie

customer_reviews.title: Just be ready to go split some wood.
customer_reviews.text: This has worked great I thought that I would have to spend $1,500.00 plus to split wood but to my surprise I have in the last two weeks split 10 ricks with 6 of those ricks being red oak. With no problem. Also this is light enough to pick up. Great working machine I would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Mike V.

customer_reviews.title: Really compact and heavy. 110 lbs in the box ...
customer_reviews.text: Really compact and heavy. 110 lbs in the box. it sits very very low to the ground. I made an 18 inch high wooden platform
customer_reviews.author: Jeffy

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I read most of the reviews and was very hesitant to purchase this product. At the end, I did buy it and couldn't be more happier with it. Right out of the box, took me and my son about 15 minutes to set it up and we split a whole lot of logs without any issues in no time. If you looking for just splitting woods for your personal use and don't want spend a whole lot of money, then this is a good choice!
customer_reviews.author: SHS

customer_reviews.title: Easy log splitter
customer_reviews.text: no more splitting wood by hand , just plug it in and easy to use splitting wood. stand it up and wheel it around easy storage .
customer_reviews.author: JAD

customer_reviews.title: Works better than expected
customer_reviews.text: This log splitter has made my work much easer. It needed a little more oil to give it full travel but except for that it is flawless . It should last a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Louis  Brackbill

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use! My husband has heart problems and can't do much and he loved how well this worked and that he can feel like he accomplished so much!
customer_reviews.author: Trudy

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to move,splits great! A little Awkward to control must use both hand. Over all it is the best choice.
customer_reviews.author: steve Gold

customer_reviews.title: Making Firewood!
customer_reviews.text: What a terrific machine. This product makes it very easy to split our oak logs for the wood stove. The log splitter operates on a normal 110v circuit, plugs right into the wall. It is quick in movement and adjustable for different log lengths. It has enough power to go through oak logs, no problem. It is easy to pick up and roll into storage on the good sized wheels. No problem. This is a great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Esther Berry

customer_reviews.title: Impressive machine
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with the power this splitter has. Have split 24” rounds no problem , be sure to open hydraulic vent at the end like directions state and will work without any problems at all, I have no problems with mine and have split a few cords of wood so far this season, it came very well packaged also , surprising for a heavy delivery about 120 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Sean C.

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Works really good have had no issues split green and dry oak with no issues thankfully I have large hands to control both button and lever at the same time. other than the levers recommended
customer_reviews.author: E.A

customer_reviews.title: Price and heavy duty quality of the splitter can’t say enough about it
customer_reviews.text: Like the fact took on bigger logs than I expected results were outstanding highly recommend this splitter
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: My husband uses this for our wood stove and it works great Thank you for an awesome product and the price was a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: bemaw_2000

customer_reviews.title: Works great and very quiet too.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband. We heat with a wood stove only. This is a lifesaver for big pieces too big to cut by hand. It’s awsomE. It’s also guilt so you can use early mornings and not wake anyone up. Wish I had bought this years ago. D. Y.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. I was impressed by the power it had. It split through logs with no problem. Convenient to store.
customer_reviews.author: Kristie Horner

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price  splits logs bigger than I had expected
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use-- small but packs a big punch-- very pleased with this electric log splitter
customer_reviews.author: John B. Chriswell

customer_reviews.title: Compact size stores easily, works very good.
customer_reviews.text: Compact little splitter does a good job for its size. I split some impressively large diameter logs. No problems while splitting a cord of wood.
customer_reviews.author: Roberta Hodgkinson

customer_reviews.title: This machine lives up to it's name.  Very powerful for an electric product.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this machine to split seasoned and green wood. My neighbors were tired of my use of a sledge hammer and splitting wedge. I was hesitant to purchase an electric unit as it is no match for a gas machine. So far I have split several cords of seasoned wood and 1/2 cord of green wood. Nothing, that's right, nothing has stopped this machine. Very, Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: WK Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Better than an axe any day!!
customer_reviews.text: Handles a pretty good load of wood. Obviously not huge stumps, but more than enough power for wood splitting at our cottage.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne

customer_reviews.title: Small durable splitter
customer_reviews.text: Works great on small to medium logs and if you can position bigger logs correctly it can slowly break them apart as well. Biggest down side is the spacing between the 2 buttons that need to be pushed down for "safety". However my hand is big enough to push both down while my other hand is used to guide the log for the splitter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best little splitter for the money
customer_reviews.text: We love this little machine, the only thing is button placement. When splitting ALL day the button/handle combo starts to hurt the hand
customer_reviews.author: Red's Random Corner

customer_reviews.title: Love it, first split on first log
customer_reviews.text: Very first split on a very big log. Beautiful. Turned that log into that pile, wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Noone

customer_reviews.title: Great splitting with much less noise.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Have not come across any wood it will not split.
customer_reviews.author: Roger L

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my homestead
customer_reviews.text: Amazing log splitter. As new homesteaders, we were reluctant to get electric wood splitter as most had not so good reviews. We are more than happy with this purchase and highly recommend to those in need.
customer_reviews.author: Tacon

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use labor saver.
customer_reviews.text: This log splitter does an excellent job splitting wood. I used it on the day it was delivered and it split every log I fed it. The only thing I regret is not buying it years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: ... log splitter I pick the Southland and was absolutely happy that I did I split a Quarterwood in about ...
customer_reviews.text: I am 70 years old and decided to buy a log splitter I pick the Southland and was absolutely happy that I did I split a Quarterwood in about three hours It was a great purchase
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: Good Value!
customer_reviews.text: Great product,unpacked this morning,started splitting wood. The only reason for 3 stars on easy to use is the two handed operation. But great splitter so far.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Thought I needed a gas splitter. Wrong.
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly effective. I have split up to 20" logs. Sometimes requires turning and splitting again for 20" diameter. 15" diameter is a single split every time. I've split almost 4 cords of wood with no problems. Don't forget to loosen the vent screw (read instructions).
customer_reviews.author: NFN

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and easy to operate. I was worried about a gas one cause I wouldnt use it a whole lot but will get its use out of and this is perfect and has taken on some good size logs.
customer_reviews.author: chris parenteau

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my husband, and he loves it. Very easy to operate
customer_reviews.author: KMS

customer_reviews.title: Broke after almost no use.
customer_reviews.text: Delivered in July. Had back surgery in August and couldn’t use it until October. It split two logs in October and then stopped working. Split maybe 50 logs before it gave up the ghost.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia Estevez

customer_reviews.title: Good little machine for the money
customer_reviews.text: I don't care for having to start the motor to get it to split but it is a safety feature to keep your hands away while it splits. I have split 24" logs. I split a little at a time but it gets it done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Scam
customer_reviews.text: The product is a scam, it has no power of 6 tonnes as they say, I am very unhappy
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't buy it again.
customer_reviews.text: The power switch and lever hsve to be workrd together. Uncomfortable to use.
customer_reviews.author: Emy

customer_reviews.title: Strong and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The carton the unit came in was pretty beat up, but was ok after unboxing. I find it to be very strong and sturdy. Excellent performance. would recommend it to all.
customer_reviews.author: Teich

customer_reviews.title: Better off splitting your wood by hand!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is garbage. I made sure I read the instructions thoroughly and it still didn’t do as stated. Not one pice of wood split the whole way through and it states that it will work on a log up to 16.5”. What a joke! This thing is getting returned ASAP!
customer_reviews.author: chris petronelis

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: Saves me lot of work with my Monster Maul. Should have bought one a few years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen A. Degray

customer_reviews.title: Well made, works great. You need one.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, split about a 1/2 cord of bbq wood, oak & pecan while sitting in a lawn chair. No problems with anything, ram returns quickly. Unit stores upright, takes up very little space. Best of all, I will never use an axe or maul again!!
customer_reviews.author: Lt Dan

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Compact
customer_reviews.text: Fast and compact. No problems with it It has split everything I put on it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Tremblay

customer_reviews.title: Good small splitter
customer_reviews.text: Good small splitter. It isn’t big and I only split 16-20 inch logs. Eucalyptus is my favorite wood and it splits it fairly well. Pine and birch should be fine too. It’s not a big heavy duty splitter. I’m happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Black Locust rounds really put it to the test (~2 cords), but there was no way I was going to split those rounds with an ax or splitting maul. Well worth the purchase, and my back is not sore!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Wood chucks would use it if they could split wood. 😉👍
customer_reviews.text: It’s a bit heavy but it is a solid well built piece of equipment. Very strong motor. It does exactly what it’s suppose to do. It splits wood. I would definitely recommend it. Just remember the hydraulic bleeder screw need to be open when operating. 😊
customer_reviews.author: 1weirddude

customer_reviews.title: Great log splitter at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: We are very pleased with our log splitter. It is easy to move around and operate. It makes splitting logs a breeze. We highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Judy-Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Great value in a log splitter!
customer_reviews.text: 6-ton electric log splitter is a great alternative to renting and towing noisy, less safe gas-powered splitters Has plenty of power to split seasoned rounds up to 24-inch diameter. Upright compact storage is clean and easy in workshop.
customer_reviews.author: Betty D

customer_reviews.title: Easy Splitting
customer_reviews.text: This electric splitter made my life much easier meaning no more splitting with a splitting maul. I am 65 and my winter heat is wood. Now using this splitter is easy. I am very happy with my splitter.
customer_reviews.author: Mary-Ann R Kelley

customer_reviews.title: This is the one you want!
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend this log splitter, for the money. Easy to use, splits logs easy.
customer_reviews.author: larry chartier

customer_reviews.title: It worked sometimes.
customer_reviews.text: It really did not have the ass I expected. Even some 6” logs, it would not split. I was hoping for more.9
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Great for home use!
customer_reviews.text: My siblings and I got this for our mom for Christmas! She absolutely loves it and it works so well! My aunt and uncle recommended this one and we're glad we listened to their advice.
customer_reviews.author: autumn

customer_reviews.title: Versitle
customer_reviews.text: Like the fact that it goes through wood like butter. No disappointments
customer_reviews.author: Joseph K

customer_reviews.title: My little log splitter excellent
customer_reviews.text: Great little machine specially if you have a stick burning smoker and a nice fireplace grate for the homeowner like it a lot
customer_reviews.author: Ram 2500

customer_reviews.title: A good splitter for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a good little lig splitter. Powerful for an electric model. I have split rounds as big as 20 inches. But the length should be no more than 18 to 20 inches.
customer_reviews.author: Tomcuc

product_meta.title: Southland Outdoor Power Equipment SELS60 6 Ton Electric Log Splitter, Red
product_meta.description: The Southland 6-Ton electric log splitter features a powerful 1.75 HP, 15 amp induction motor that effortlessly splits the most demanding types of wood. Safer & more productive than swinging a maul & axe. The integrated stroke limiter reduces cycle times for shorter logs. The heavy duty 5" steel wedge splits logs quickly & easily. The vertical storage option on the 6-Ton log splitter allows for less space to be taken in the garage or shop. Voltage- 120.
feature_bullets: Heavy duty 1.75 HP, 15 amp induction motor delivers maximum performance for the most rugged condition
Effortlessly does big splitting jobs with a 18-second cycle time
Integrated stroke limiter can adjust to a shorter stroke for smaller logs
7" wheels and configuration to vertical position provides maneuverability and easy storage

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars285 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
